title: Sri Lanka to exhume body to check identity ‘Sara Jasmin’
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is exhuming the remains of a victim who died in a suicide blast in Eastern Sri Lanka’s along with 16 others to carry out a DNA identity check in a bid to find out whether she is really the wife of an Easter Sunday bomber, police said.
Pulasthini Mahendran also known as Sara Jasmin was the wife of Mohammed Hasthun, the suicide bomber suspected to have attacked Katuwapitiya churn on April 19.
On April 26, she was said to have been one of 17 who died in a safe house in Saindamarindu in Amparai.
“Thought there were two  investigations it was not finally proved by DNA evidence,” Police said in a statement.
“Therefore investigators sought permission from Magistrate Courts to exhume the body.”

There has been speculation that ‘Sara Jasmin’ had been spirited away to India. An witness at a Presidential Commission of Inquiry had reportedly said that she could have tipped off Indian intelligence about the impending attack. (Colombo/Apr27/2022)
